qas.question: When is Tucson's city council primary?
How long are Tucson's city council terms?
When is Tucson's city council general election?
Which wards elect city council members in the same year as the mayor?
Which wards elect city council members in the alternate year from the mayor?

context: Both the council members and the mayor serve <a1_0>four-year<a1_0/> terms; none face term limits. Council members are nominated by their wards via a ward-level primary held in <a0_0>September<a0_0/>. The top vote-earners from each party then compete at-large for their ward's seat on the <a2_0>November<a2_0/> ballot. In other words, on election day the whole city votes on all the council races up for that year. Council elections are severed: Wards <a3_0>1, 2, and 4<a3_0/> (as well as the mayor) are up for election in the same year (most recently 2011), while Wards <a4_0>3, 5, and 6<a4_0/> share another year (most recently 2013).
